tittle: Rapid response healthcare staffing therefore inconsistent opportunities available. However when opportunities avail themselves this company does is go
author: Emergency Department, Registered Nurse Emergency
comment: I would recommend this company. This company opportunities include rapid responses and short term positions. The company is a responsive employer however can become chaotic during employment for an assignment. This company is constantly tweaking to make the onboarding process more efficient and user-friendly.

author: Staff Nurse
comment: The company is very unorganized. The company lacks communication among each other. Multiple calls from different agents stating contradictory information pertaining to the same subject.

tittle: No job security and you work your butt off.
author: RN Staff Nurse
comment: It was good way back in the day, but no loyalty now. The on-site manager was known to send people home if she didn’t like them and you could never go to them with issues. Shift assignments went to their pets and you were randomly mandated to take a day off if they brought too many people in.

author: Registered Nurse
comment: It used to be owned and operated by a single owner and at the time I traveled they were the best paying travel company . Then the owner passed away and the company incorporated and now they have it divided up into so many different categories of pay vs benefits that now you pretty much just go with the travel company that can put you in the location you want

author: Registered Nurse
comment: The standard one would expect from any healthcare institution. Culture is congruent with the culture of the city it sits in. Work day is standard. 1234

author: Registered Nurse-TRAVEL
comment: Most assignments were to busy units and when assigned unit was not busy, the travel nurse floated first. Host hospitals were easy to work for, never had any conflict, always had any issues resolved quickly and fairly.

pros: ["my recruiter and the salary was above average."]
author: Registered Nurse
comment: I loved all my temporary travel assignments. Labor and Delivery always had many to choices.

cons: ["Sometimes a long distance to isolated locations."]
tittle: Variable schedules, Allowed to refuse certain assignments,
author: Registered Nurse
comment: Nurses and Professionals Healthcare is a local registry started by an RN about 1990. Over the years moved from a two room office in Paradise, CA to a large office complex in Chico. I have worked with this agency since 1994 and have enjoyed my experiences.  A typical day involved organizing the different locations around the state that I was assigned to work. My furthest location was 390 miles from home. I learned to be flexible with assignment requirements and was able to rely on office staff to manage housing, reimbursement of expenses, and to handle any emergencies.  I rarely saw any of my registry coworkers at distance sites but were always cordial.  The hardest part was learning new charting programs at different sites; up to four in a week. Developing proficiency in any one program was difficult.  I most enjoyed the scenic drives through the heart of California and seeing many new areas I have never seen.

author: RN
comment: Again, I find these survey questions annoying. I do not like working as a registry nurse and I do not recommend it to any one. You shouldn't bait and switch people on this site.

cons: ["not much room for advancement in my department"]
author: RN
comment: I enjoy working as a nurse and working with an interdisciplinary team of healthcare professionals. A typical day at my present employment includes working with parents of infants in preparation for discharge and providing parents with the tools and skills necessary to succeed.

pros: ["Great co-workers, great medical director, great workload"]
cons: ["only con was Less money for working for no benefits."]
tittle: Enjoyable atmosphere to work in; good relationships with coworkers, doctors, and clients
author: Staff RN
comment: I worked in Occupational Medicine/Employee Health. We were responsible for giving and reading all employee TB skin tests as well as other immunizations that were needed for work. Our department was also contracted with some local business to do physical assessments and drug screens on their prospective hires. I enjoyed learning the proper way to do a physical assessment. Finding out everything that is involved in doing a drug screen Correctly was very interesting - and finding out the ways people would try to get around it! I always enjoyed my co-workers. Many of us had known each other and worked together in other areas of the hospital for years. I enjoyed everything about the job, including the boss. I think the hardest part of the job was the pay. They were not of the mindset that your pay should be More than average if you are not receiving benefits. As a result, the pay was lower than a new nurse coming in. But I still loved it - fantastic working environment. Miss it.

cons: ["there is no job security and benefits"]
tittle: good place to work for enrtry level
author: Staff Nurse
comment: It is a staffing and caregiving agency. There is no job security. When your patient dies, you lose your job and would wait for days and months before you are given another assignment.

author: RN Travel Nurse
comment: Flexible hours and excellent pay. Opportunity to meet great people. Travel to New areas and learn more about Healthcare. Great Opportunity for overtime, pet friendly housing included.

author: RN Travel Nurse
comment: They “promised” Covid pay in the contract but it was not paid. I was a counselor to my recruiter. When I got Covid I was let go from my contract after working 2 extra days almost weekly.

author: Registered Nurse
comment: No smooth process. Multi submission of documents due to system issues. Difficult to complete if you have to speak to a different person each time. Errors made by associates. Low pay on contracts.

author: RN Staff Nurse
comment: I have enjoyed my time there. Management is good and pays attention to your needs. I feel valued as an employee bug wish work life balance was better.

tittle: Horrible people that doesn't care about their staff
author: RN
comment: Worst place to work. They don't care about you and will stiff you of your pay. Wasted my time to go work for them and I was never paid. Horrible experience for me. Put me off travel nursing.

author: RN
comment: I really love working here, I love my recruiter who works hard to get contracts for me that suit my needs. I wish there were more available contracts.

author: RN
comment: I have completed 6 travel assignments with them. My recruiter has been awesome, all other supportive staff has been amazing. No payroll issues, checks have been on time and correct for each assignment.

author: RN
comment: This is the worst agency I’ve ever had a contract with — poor communication and zero support. My contract ended in 2020 and I am STILL upset about the whole experience. AVOID!

author: Registered Nurse
comment: Overall good experience on multiple assignments. My recruiter was very responsive and had a good working relationship. Had one bad experience on one assignment and wasn’t well supported by company.

pros: ["Paychecks on time, no issues, very straightforward."]
tittle: My recruiter was respectful and answered all questions. Worked with them for a year. Paychecks are always on time, had no issues at any of my jobs
author: RN
comment: My recruiter was respectful and answered all questions. Worked with them for a year. Paychecks are always on time, had no issues at any of my jobs. Very responsive you can always reach someone.

cons: ["Lack of recruiter support when issues came up."]
tittle: I can't think if anything that stands out. Benefits are not as plentiful as other companies
author: RN Travel Nurse
comment: Did not feel my recruiter stood up for me when needed and allowed me to be transferred from the original contract area to another area without asking if I wanted to go to the new area. An issue came up while working with this company and I didnt feel as though I had any back up.

tittle: You have to stay on top of recruiter...
author: Registered Nurse
state: Found that had to frequently direct and then redirect recruiter in obtaining placements and answers.  Be careful. They ask you to pay for things up front and say they will will reimburse you sometimes over $300 up front prior to working things and when say no they continue to ask you to pay saying will be reimbursed. Say they cover expenses to get ready for the job Such as drug testing and vaccinations. Was told needed a current vaccination that had they told me 2 days earlier could have gotten at doctor office when there but as such would have had to make another appointment so while getting drug tested and fit tested was given vaccine and theythen come back and say that not covering that so they end up taking it out of paycheck.  Management is so so.  Poor turn around on answering questions answered.

author: Registered Nurse
comment: Staff will work with you to get the assignment and compensation you desire. Very organized and responsive. Staff is friendly and always willing to answer questions.

cons: ["No loyalty, take money away if you miss a day of work, too much overhead staff"]
tittle: They don’t have your back but always side with the company you’re currently working at if something goes wrong
author: Registered Nurse
comment: They don’t have their employees backs whenever the company you’re working at tells blatant lies, you get physically attacked by a pt and they drop you like a hot potato! They take money away from your pay if you miss a day of work even though we already don’t get paid since we have no sick day pay. They have way too many hands in the cookie jar that with every assignment your core team always changes!!

tittle: Have completed a few travel assignement and did not have a problem.
author: RN
comment: Work-life balance Work-life balance at RNnetwork is travel nursing contract negotiations  Management In general, managers at RNnetwork easy to communicate with

author: RN
comment: My recruiter looked out for me and my interests. She would call and check on me to make sure everything was doing ok. The only complaint I had was that the hospital canceled my contract with no warning and RN network did not offer any compensation for my immediate loss of work

cons: ["Changes in ancillary staff not being communicated in timely manner."]
tittle: Traveler support services are changing. I have a great relationship with my recruiter and am very happy.
author: RN Travel Nurse
comment: Travel nurses need support services that they can count on, I have been pleased with the results. My recruiter has been great fun and great at her job.

tittle: If you dont mind working alone, and like to travel - this job is for you.
author: RN
comment: Typical day at work depends on what area of facility/hospital you work in. You will learn how travel nurses are received at a facility. Management changes hands with your shift schedules. Workplace culture is great.

author: Registered Nurse
comment: RNnetwork is a travel nurse agency with great benefits and insurance. Part of my review is skewed because it’s having to evaluate where I’ve worked which RNNetwork has no control, as they found me an assignment and place to work so things like making me feel inclusive, or management isn’t totally about RNnetwork but where I was assigned. RNnetwork is a great company and I thoroughly enjoyed working with them. They were always there for me when I needed them.

author: Traveling Registered Nurse
comment: Good people to work for. Recruiters are good and try to get you decent pay packages. Travel nursing as a whole is going downhill, but some companies try to make the most of it still.

author: RN
comment: I think my recruiter could have been more support at the time. I understand they need to get people into the job but during this time they should have been more support to the employee

author: RN Travel Nurse
comment: Flexible hours and excellent pay. Opportunity to meet great people. Travel to New areas and learn more about Healthcare. Great Opportunity for overtime, pet friendly housing included.

cons: ["I worked for a facility with poor conditions"]
author: REGISTERED PROFESSIONAL NURSE
comment: The company doesn’t do the work for you. You have to do all the connecting by yourself ( I. E. the license, the room and board, the drug and health screening and the actual job), as the company is not local; they just pay you. In some cases, you have to find your own work. If you happen to allow them to hook up room and transportation, make sure you have ( or they provide you with) a reliable way of getting to work; it could 30 miles away from where you live! ....🙄😕.

tittle: Would certainly work there again if decided to travel.
author: Registered Nurse
comment: Excellent place to work. Help was readily available when needed. My resource person was easy to get in contact with, and provided valuable insight to a potential problem.

author: RN Staff
comment: They never support their workers, it has been the worse experience in my life. I can't say anything good about this Company . Every time I had a concern, nobody gave me answers

tittle: working for RN Network was a great experience
author: RN Staff Nurse/traveler
comment: I worked with RN network as a traveler to different areas of the country. I never went to the actual office in Florida. Spoke with them on the phone often and had a recruiter that worked closely with me and was always there for me.

cons: ["couldnt always reach benefits persons or recruiter"]
tittle: staff works hard to get you hired
author: RN
comment: staff works hard to get you hired. working at different facilities on a frequent basis gives you the opportunity to learn about new medical issues - equipment, care of specialty patients, other ancillary staff, new MD interns. Must be able to navigate in any new city they send you to and find your own accomidations if necessary. Must provide some of your own equipment to perform daily duties - O2 sat probe, stethoscope, pill cutter, pill crusher, vein finder if affordable.

author: Registered Nurse
comment: Solid travel company doing the best they can to offer contracts in a variety of locations with moderate pay for market competition. Recruiters are hospitable and truly care that you are happy.

author: Registered Nurse
comment: nice company to work for. pay was great..staff members were helpful. RN network help me build my skills to become a better nurse. if I had to choose them again, I will.

author: STAFF RN
comment: Helps you get established in your field when you are new to the area. Everyone was very helpful and nice to work with during my transition of employment.

author: Staff Nurse
comment: Traveling was truly and adventure. Management worked with what you were looking for, housing was always great and assignments were fun and adventurous. Areas always had a lot of things to do when not working.

author: Registered Nurse
comment: Working with this travel agency was nice, my recruiter was great and handled everything in a professional manner. The travel agency found work in areas that I requested.

tittle: A personal and professional company with respect for the staff.
author: Registered Nurse
comment: I worked as an Acute Dialysis Nurse and the job is unpredictable as expected, many times extremely log days. It was very difficult achieving a balance with other aspects of life. The people were respectful, available and willing to work out any job related issue. The most enjoyable part of my job was the patient care and ease in working with FMS staff.

author: Registered Nurse
comment: Great people to work for, assignments were easy to set up, no problems with getting paid or renewing contracts. would recommend this travel company for traveling

author: RN
comment: All the employees are helpful & make it about the nurses. I always have the info required for my next location. Supportive all through the contract. enjoyed it.

author: RN
comment: Very productive at job placement. Recruiters treat nurses like family. Staff is easily available and returns calls promptly. Strives to find the best jobs with high pay rates

tittle: Very good place to work as a travel nurse
author: RN
comment: RN network is always on top of things; some one is always available for help; good & very up beat people at RN Network; benifits are good along with the housing

pros: ["benefits, housing, helping with recertification classes, mileage reimbursement, double time for overtime pay"]
author: Registered Nurse
comment: My recruiter is awesome, contacting me every Monday to see how I'm doing. The supervisor is great also. I love this company. The benefit package is great too. My housing has been fantastic. The credentialing department is fantastic, finding classes for recertification.

author: Registered Nurse
comment: A typical day at work was filled with cardiac issues but great teamwork and attitudes to go along with it. I learned how to become competent in a job with little training. Management and my co workers were overly helpful and were a big part of the reason that I adjusted so fast. My experience and skills with cardiac illness helped me to feel very confident, so I would have to say the hardest part was working night shift. Although I have been doing this shift for two plus years it is really beginning to take a toll on my body and I am looking to move off of this shift soon.

pros: ["there when you need them, good benefits, helpful recruiters"]
tittle: usually had positions where I wanted to travel and good benefits
author: RN
comment: I worked for RNNETWORK for approximately 10 years. I found them to be readily accessible and had numerous jobs to choose from. I liked their benefits and really never had an issue with them

author: RN Staff Nurse
comment: Able to communicate with coordinator as needed when events arrive.

author: RN
comment: Typical day at work depends on what area of facility/hospital you work in. You will learn how travel nurses are received at a facility. Management changes hands with your shift schedules. Workplace culture is great.

author: Registered Nurse
comment: RNnetwork is a travel nurse agency with great benefits and insurance. Part of my review is skewed because it’s having to evaluate where I’ve worked which RNNetwork has no control, as they found me an assignment and place to work so things like making me feel inclusive, or management isn’t totally about RNnetwork but where I was assigned. RNnetwork is a great company and I thoroughly enjoyed working with them. They were always there for me when I needed them.

author: Traveling Registered Nurse
comment: Good people to work for. Recruiters are good and try to get you decent pay packages. Travel nursing as a whole is going downhill, but some companies try to make the most of it still.

author: RN
comment: I think my recruiter could have been more support at the time. I understand they need to get people into the job but during this time they should have been more support to the employee

author: RN Travel Nurse
comment: Flexible hours and excellent pay. Opportunity to meet great people. Travel to New areas and learn more about Healthcare. Great Opportunity for overtime, pet friendly housing included.

cons: ["I worked for a facility with poor conditions"]
author: REGISTERED PROFESSIONAL NURSE
comment: The company doesn’t do the work for you. You have to do all the connecting by yourself ( I. E. the license, the room and board, the drug and health screening and the actual job), as the company is not local; they just pay you. In some cases, you have to find your own work. If you happen to allow them to hook up room and transportation, make sure you have ( or they provide you with) a reliable way of getting to work; it could 30 miles away from where you live! ....🙄😕.

tittle: Would certainly work there again if decided to travel.
author: Registered Nurse
comment: Excellent place to work. Help was readily available when needed. My resource person was easy to get in contact with, and provided valuable insight to a potential problem.

author: RN Staff
comment: They never support their workers, it has been the worse experience in my life. I can't say anything good about this Company . Every time I had a concern, nobody gave me answers

tittle: working for RN Network was a great experience
author: RN Staff Nurse/traveler
comment: I worked with RN network as a traveler to different areas of the country. I never went to the actual office in Florida. Spoke with them on the phone often and had a recruiter that worked closely with me and was always there for me.

cons: ["couldnt always reach benefits persons or recruiter"]
tittle: staff works hard to get you hired
author: RN
comment: staff works hard to get you hired. working at different facilities on a frequent basis gives you the opportunity to learn about new medical issues - equipment, care of specialty patients, other ancillary staff, new MD interns. Must be able to navigate in any new city they send you to and find your own accomidations if necessary. Must provide some of your own equipment to perform daily duties - O2 sat probe, stethoscope, pill cutter, pill crusher, vein finder if affordable.

author: Registered Nurse
comment: Solid travel company doing the best they can to offer contracts in a variety of locations with moderate pay for market competition. Recruiters are hospitable and truly care that you are happy.

author: Registered Nurse
comment: nice company to work for. pay was great..staff members were helpful. RN network help me build my skills to become a better nurse. if I had to choose them again, I will.

author: STAFF RN
comment: Helps you get established in your field when you are new to the area. Everyone was very helpful and nice to work with during my transition of employment.

author: Staff Nurse
comment: Traveling was truly and adventure. Management worked with what you were looking for, housing was always great and assignments were fun and adventurous. Areas always had a lot of things to do when not working.

author: Registered Nurse
comment: Working with this travel agency was nice, my recruiter was great and handled everything in a professional manner. The travel agency found work in areas that I requested.

tittle: A personal and professional company with respect for the staff.
author: Registered Nurse
comment: I worked as an Acute Dialysis Nurse and the job is unpredictable as expected, many times extremely log days. It was very difficult achieving a balance with other aspects of life. The people were respectful, available and willing to work out any job related issue. The most enjoyable part of my job was the patient care and ease in working with FMS staff.

author: Registered Nurse
comment: Great people to work for, assignments were easy to set up, no problems with getting paid or renewing contracts. would recommend this travel company for traveling

author: RN
comment: All the employees are helpful & make it about the nurses. I always have the info required for my next location. Supportive all through the contract. enjoyed it.

author: RN
comment: Very productive at job placement. Recruiters treat nurses like family. Staff is easily available and returns calls promptly. Strives to find the best jobs with high pay rates

tittle: Very good place to work as a travel nurse
author: RN
comment: RN network is always on top of things; some one is always available for help; good & very up beat people at RN Network; benifits are good along with the housing

pros: ["benefits, housing, helping with recertification classes, mileage reimbursement, double time for overtime pay"]
author: Registered Nurse
comment: My recruiter is awesome, contacting me every Monday to see how I'm doing. The supervisor is great also. I love this company. The benefit package is great too. My housing has been fantastic. The credentialing department is fantastic, finding classes for recertification.

author: Registered Nurse
comment: A typical day at work was filled with cardiac issues but great teamwork and attitudes to go along with it. I learned how to become competent in a job with little training. Management and my co workers were overly helpful and were a big part of the reason that I adjusted so fast. My experience and skills with cardiac illness helped me to feel very confident, so I would have to say the hardest part was working night shift. Although I have been doing this shift for two plus years it is really beginning to take a toll on my body and I am looking to move off of this shift soon.

pros: ["there when you need them, good benefits, helpful recruiters"]
tittle: usually had positions where I wanted to travel and good benefits
author: RN
comment: I worked for RNNETWORK for approximately 10 years. I found them to be readily accessible and had numerous jobs to choose from. I liked their benefits and really never had an issue with them

author: RN Staff Nurse
comment: Able to communicate with coordinator as needed when events arrive.

pros: ["Responsive and kind Recruiter and Client Service Manager"]
tittle: Fantastic Recruiter and Client Service Manager who are very responsive.
author: RN
comment: Client Services Manager met me, walked me into the facility and introduced me to the Staff that I would be working with. Questions answered and issues dealt with quickly. Each placement is different, so it is nice when the Sites have been vetted by Covelo Group prior to placing its healthcare professionals. Not a 1099 Contract company, so taxes are taken out of pay, which is a huge plus!

tittle: It has been a pleasure and I continue to work with them
author: Registered Nurse
comment: What is the best part of working at the company? My recruiters are amazing and always work to make sure I am happy at the facility I am contracted with.  What is the most stressful part about working at the company? Haven’t had an issue yet thankfully  What is the work environment and culture like at the company? Very friendly and pro employee  What is a typical day like for you at the company? Depends where they get your contract at

pros: ["Great pay, wonderful team, fast response time"]
author: RN
comment: I have enjoyed working for this company so far. They offer competitive pay, and go out of their way to get you the best pay that you deserve. The recruitment team is great at finding a position that works with my schedule and fits my family.

pros: ["Free lunch, great pay, benefits, stellar team"]
author: Registered Nurse (RN)
comment: My experience with Covelo group has been fantastic. The job I was assigned to could not be better. They even cater us food twice a shift! The work is laid back, the expectations are clear, and my coworkers are pretty easy to get along with overall. Highly recommend.

tittle: Recruiter works hard to support YOU!
author: RN
comment: Refreshing to work for a company who is professional and supportive of their staff! My recruiter promptly returns communications, has been quick to troubleshoot questions during onboarding process and even sent my local Covelo representative to "meet and greet" me on the first day of my contract with a new client. If you are confident in your profession and contract work is something you have never tried and are interested in, I highly recommend Covelo Group, my recruiter and local rep have been amazing!

author: RN Vaccinator
comment: Working with covelo was okay to start, compensation was lower than average but you get what you sign up for. Usually flexible with scheduling depeniding on the location you arr assigned to.

tittle: Friendly staff, smooth onboarding process & good pay
author: RN
comment: I appreciate the opportunity Covelo Group offered me to work for a large reputable hospital in the bay area. The entire boarding process was very smooth, I was given very clear instructions every step along the way. I feel the staff members of Covelo respect their employees and treat them well.

author: Registered Nurse (RN)
comment: As a new grad, working for Covelo has given me the opportunity to work with reputable hospitals within my area. This has helped me build connections with other coworkers and staff members, who I may use as references for future career opportunities. My recruiter was always responsive and helpful to any questions or concerns I had. The other contractors and I initially had some concerns regarding our hours, but Covelo listened and handled the issue promptly with a reasonable solution. All my coworkers have been pleasant to work with and the work culture for my assignment is positive and supportive.

tittle: I liked working for MGA, good company
author: RN/Staff Nurse - Registry
comment: I liked working for MGA, good company, I only separated after, I found full time employment with benefits. Management was professional and fair, no problem with MGA. The work culture was fair and professional.

author: RN Staff Nurse
comment: Very little training. Recruiters were the "go to" people for Nurses, not Nursing Supervisor. No pre-employment testing to assess adequate job skills for the job. And

author: REGISTERED NURSE
comment: Registry work with contracts..You interview with families to determine if you are right fit for their home. You have to work with families schedules in order to get hours. You may have to work with multiple families.

author: Wellness Registered Nurse (RN)
comment: good if you can't find a steady job, they're super nice and youll still get experience, i worked as a flu nurse so it was a good first job out of school,

author: Registered Nurse
comment: Provided travel assignments at distant locations. Frequent cancellations.. Would leave assignments when Staff arrived.Would get paid for four hours when Companies had there employees arrive.

author: Registered Nurse
comment: Okay temp. job but doesn't really provide opportunity for advancement. This agency has more a sales atmosphere feel than one promoting healthcare. Some recruiters don't provide prompt follow-up for job opportunities.

author: Registered Nurse
comment: Provided direct patient and family care. Excelled with nursing skills for long term pediatric care. Coordinated assignments accordingly to meet daily goals and deadlines. Provided family support with home health care. Attended physical therapy treatments to maintain continuity of patient care. Provided flexible hours of operation.

tittle: Office setting with many people at work. nice staff, very calm, no rush
author: RN
comment: The work day did not involve MGA staff very much because we were sent to hospitals and were doing our job there. the staff let us work without hovering over us like other companies might

tittle: Very busy agency with many helpful employees
author: RN
comment: Very accurate and helpful. Very patient. Able to keep me busy most of the time. Handle the background paperwork for the employee which is incredibly helpful.

pros: ["Lots of free tme to play with child"]
tittle: Caring for ill children and encouraging parents
author: RN
comment: Good way to assist parent with difficulties in caring for an ill child. Low stress, high detail to the patient. Very personal in nature every shift.

author: Urgent Care Registered Nurse
comment: typical day at work: Varies with placement  What you learned: first nursing job, learned IM injection, starting IV's, performing blood draws, triage patients in an urgent care facility  Work Culture: varies depending on job placement  The hardest part of job: being flexible about job placement  The most enjoyable part of job: opportunity to explore different areas of nursing and get experience at the same time

cons: ["No benefits, no room for job advancement"]
tittle: Positive experience working with MGA Healthcare
author: RN
comment: MGA Healthcare has been a fantastic experience for me so far! The recruiters that the other nurses and I have worked with/encountered have been extremely polite, responsive, and helpful. They reply to my e-mails and phone calls quickly and are always willing to listen to and address my concerns. My recruiter has also stopped by the facility we are contracted at to check up on us personally and bring us lunch/desserts. He also works closely with the facility's management to ensure that our needs, and their needs from us, are being met adequately.  Only cons are there are no benefits (that I know of) and there isn't much room for job advancement.

author: Registered Nurse
comment: Really great to their nurses and offer great benefits but do not offer a 401k. I love working for them,=. They really look after their nurses. Sometimes even deliver lunches to you and your patient. So easy to pick up shifts

pros: ["Responsive and kind Recruiter and Client Service Manager"]
tittle: Fantastic Recruiter and Client Service Manager who are very responsive.
author: RN
comment: Client Services Manager met me, walked me into the facility and introduced me to the Staff that I would be working with. Questions answered and issues dealt with quickly. Each placement is different, so it is nice when the Sites have been vetted by Covelo Group prior to placing its healthcare professionals. Not a 1099 Contract company, so taxes are taken out of pay, which is a huge plus!

author: Registered Nurse
comment: MGA is a very good staffing agency to work for, I worked the flu shot clinic for 2014 as my very first nursing job. After the temporary position ended, I still received many calls for other positions I was qualified for. Unfortunately I had a full time job and could not further work for MGA. Definitely recommend to new nurses or nurses who may want per diem or temporary shifts.

author: RN
comment: shifts were not always available making it hard to pay the bills at times

tittle: this company was ok to work for
author: Registered Nurse
comment: This company was ok to work for but had limited facilities that is was servicing and limited number of hours that were available.

tittle: Good company with strong values but poor compensation and employee retention
author: Registered Nurse
comment: Below standard pay and no benefits, but the people are nice. There is no help for employees in personal crisis, however, which is unfortunate for a company with such great potential... Management is quick to respond to concerns, but sometimes slow in their resolution of issues. Although the hours are flexible, a nurse might sometimes finds his/herself without any work at all for weeks at a time.

tittle: Rapid response healthcare staffing therefore inconsistent opportunities available. However when opportunities avail themselves this company does is go
author: Emergency Department, Registered Nurse Emergency
comment: I would recommend this company. This company opportunities include rapid responses and short term positions. The company is a responsive employer however can become chaotic during employment for an assignment. This company is constantly tweaking to make the onboarding process more efficient and user-friendly.

author: Staff Nurse
comment: The company is very unorganized. The company lacks communication among each other. Multiple calls from different agents stating contradictory information pertaining to the same subject.

tittle: No job security and you work your butt off.
author: RN Staff Nurse
comment: It was good way back in the day, but no loyalty now. The on-site manager was known to send people home if she didn’t like them and you could never go to them with issues. Shift assignments went to their pets and you were randomly mandated to take a day off if they brought too many people in.

author: Registered Nurse
comment: It used to be owned and operated by a single owner and at the time I traveled they were the best paying travel company . Then the owner passed away and the company incorporated and now they have it divided up into so many different categories of pay vs benefits that now you pretty much just go with the travel company that can put you in the location you want

author: Registered Nurse
comment: The standard one would expect from any healthcare institution. Culture is congruent with the culture of the city it sits in. Work day is standard. 1234

author: Registered Nurse-TRAVEL
comment: Most assignments were to busy units and when assigned unit was not busy, the travel nurse floated first. Host hospitals were easy to work for, never had any conflict, always had any issues resolved quickly and fairly.

pros: ["my recruiter and the salary was above average."]
author: Registered Nurse
comment: I loved all my temporary travel assignments. Labor and Delivery always had many to choices.

cons: ["Sometimes a long distance to isolated locations."]
tittle: Variable schedules, Allowed to refuse certain assignments,
author: Registered Nurse
comment: Nurses and Professionals Healthcare is a local registry started by an RN about 1990. Over the years moved from a two room office in Paradise, CA to a large office complex in Chico. I have worked with this agency since 1994 and have enjoyed my experiences.  A typical day involved organizing the different locations around the state that I was assigned to work. My furthest location was 390 miles from home. I learned to be flexible with assignment requirements and was able to rely on office staff to manage housing, reimbursement of expenses, and to handle any emergencies.  I rarely saw any of my registry coworkers at distance sites but were always cordial.  The hardest part was learning new charting programs at different sites; up to four in a week. Developing proficiency in any one program was difficult.  I most enjoyed the scenic drives through the heart of California and seeing many new areas I have never seen.

author: RN
comment: Again, I find these survey questions annoying. I do not like working as a registry nurse and I do not recommend it to any one. You shouldn't bait and switch people on this site.

cons: ["not much room for advancement in my department"]
author: RN
comment: I enjoy working as a nurse and working with an interdisciplinary team of healthcare professionals. A typical day at my present employment includes working with parents of infants in preparation for discharge and providing parents with the tools and skills necessary to succeed.

pros: ["Great co-workers, great medical director, great workload"]
cons: ["only con was Less money for working for no benefits."]
tittle: Enjoyable atmosphere to work in; good relationships with coworkers, doctors, and clients
author: Staff RN
comment: I worked in Occupational Medicine/Employee Health. We were responsible for giving and reading all employee TB skin tests as well as other immunizations that were needed for work. Our department was also contracted with some local business to do physical assessments and drug screens on their prospective hires. I enjoyed learning the proper way to do a physical assessment. Finding out everything that is involved in doing a drug screen Correctly was very interesting - and finding out the ways people would try to get around it! I always enjoyed my co-workers. Many of us had known each other and worked together in other areas of the hospital for years. I enjoyed everything about the job, including the boss. I think the hardest part of the job was the pay. They were not of the mindset that your pay should be More than average if you are not receiving benefits. As a result, the pay was lower than a new nurse coming in. But I still loved it - fantastic working environment. Miss it.

cons: ["there is no job security and benefits"]
tittle: good place to work for enrtry level
author: Staff Nurse
comment: It is a staffing and caregiving agency. There is no job security. When your patient dies, you lose your job and would wait for days and months before you are given another assignment.

author: RN Travel Nurse
comment: Flexible hours and excellent pay. Opportunity to meet great people. Travel to New areas and learn more about Healthcare. Great Opportunity for overtime, pet friendly housing included.

author: RN Travel Nurse
comment: They “promised” Covid pay in the contract but it was not paid. I was a counselor to my recruiter. When I got Covid I was let go from my contract after working 2 extra days almost weekly.

author: Registered Nurse
comment: No smooth process. Multi submission of documents due to system issues. Difficult to complete if you have to speak to a different person each time. Errors made by associates. Low pay on contracts.

author: RN Staff Nurse
comment: I have enjoyed my time there. Management is good and pays attention to your needs. I feel valued as an employee bug wish work life balance was better.

tittle: Horrible people that doesn't care about their staff
author: RN
comment: Worst place to work. They don't care about you and will stiff you of your pay. Wasted my time to go work for them and I was never paid. Horrible experience for me. Put me off travel nursing.

author: RN
comment: I really love working here, I love my recruiter who works hard to get contracts for me that suit my needs. I wish there were more available contracts.

author: RN
comment: I have completed 6 travel assignments with them. My recruiter has been awesome, all other supportive staff has been amazing. No payroll issues, checks have been on time and correct for each assignment.

author: RN
comment: This is the worst agency I’ve ever had a contract with — poor communication and zero support. My contract ended in 2020 and I am STILL upset about the whole experience. AVOID!

author: Registered Nurse
comment: Overall good experience on multiple assignments. My recruiter was very responsive and had a good working relationship. Had one bad experience on one assignment and wasn’t well supported by company.

pros: ["Paychecks on time, no issues, very straightforward."]
tittle: My recruiter was respectful and answered all questions. Worked with them for a year. Paychecks are always on time, had no issues at any of my jobs
author: RN
comment: My recruiter was respectful and answered all questions. Worked with them for a year. Paychecks are always on time, had no issues at any of my jobs. Very responsive you can always reach someone.

cons: ["Lack of recruiter support when issues came up."]
tittle: I can't think if anything that stands out. Benefits are not as plentiful as other companies
author: RN Travel Nurse
comment: Did not feel my recruiter stood up for me when needed and allowed me to be transferred from the original contract area to another area without asking if I wanted to go to the new area. An issue came up while working with this company and I didnt feel as though I had any back up.

tittle: You have to stay on top of recruiter...
author: Registered Nurse
state: Found that had to frequently direct and then redirect recruiter in obtaining placements and answers.  Be careful. They ask you to pay for things up front and say they will will reimburse you sometimes over $300 up front prior to working things and when say no they continue to ask you to pay saying will be reimbursed. Say they cover expenses to get ready for the job Such as drug testing and vaccinations. Was told needed a current vaccination that had they told me 2 days earlier could have gotten at doctor office when there but as such would have had to make another appointment so while getting drug tested and fit tested was given vaccine and theythen come back and say that not covering that so they end up taking it out of paycheck.  Management is so so.  Poor turn around on answering questions answered.

author: Registered Nurse
comment: Staff will work with you to get the assignment and compensation you desire. Very organized and responsive. Staff is friendly and always willing to answer questions.

cons: ["No loyalty, take money away if you miss a day of work, too much overhead staff"]
tittle: They don’t have your back but always side with the company you’re currently working at if something goes wrong
author: Registered Nurse
comment: They don’t have their employees backs whenever the company you’re working at tells blatant lies, you get physically attacked by a pt and they drop you like a hot potato! They take money away from your pay if you miss a day of work even though we already don’t get paid since we have no sick day pay. They have way too many hands in the cookie jar that with every assignment your core team always changes!!

tittle: Have completed a few travel assignement and did not have a problem.
author: RN
comment: Work-life balance Work-life balance at RNnetwork is travel nursing contract negotiations  Management In general, managers at RNnetwork easy to communicate with

author: RN
comment: My recruiter looked out for me and my interests. She would call and check on me to make sure everything was doing ok. The only complaint I had was that the hospital canceled my contract with no warning and RN network did not offer any compensation for my immediate loss of work

cons: ["Changes in ancillary staff not being communicated in timely manner."]
tittle: Traveler support services are changing. I have a great relationship with my recruiter and am very happy.
author: RN Travel Nurse
comment: Travel nurses need support services that they can count on, I have been pleased with the results. My recruiter has been great fun and great at her job.

tittle: If you dont mind working alone, and like to travel - this job is for you.
author: RN
comment: Typical day at work depends on what area of facility/hospital you work in. You will learn how travel nurses are received at a facility. Management changes hands with your shift schedules. Workplace culture is great.

author: Registered Nurse
comment: RNnetwork is a travel nurse agency with great benefits and insurance. Part of my review is skewed because it’s having to evaluate where I’ve worked which RNNetwork has no control, as they found me an assignment and place to work so things like making me feel inclusive, or management isn’t totally about RNnetwork but where I was assigned. RNnetwork is a great company and I thoroughly enjoyed working with them. They were always there for me when I needed them.

author: Traveling Registered Nurse
comment: Good people to work for. Recruiters are good and try to get you decent pay packages. Travel nursing as a whole is going downhill, but some companies try to make the most of it still.

author: RN
comment: I think my recruiter could have been more support at the time. I understand they need to get people into the job but during this time they should have been more support to the employee

author: RN Travel Nurse
comment: Flexible hours and excellent pay. Opportunity to meet great people. Travel to New areas and learn more about Healthcare. Great Opportunity for overtime, pet friendly housing included.

cons: ["I worked for a facility with poor conditions"]

comment: The company doesn’t do the work for you. You have to do all the connecting by yourself ( I. E. the license, the room and board, the drug and health screening and the actual job), as the company is not local; they just pay you. In some cases, you have to find your own work. If you happen to allow them to hook up room and transportation, make sure you have ( or they provide you with) a reliable way of getting to work; it could 30 miles away from where you live! ....🙄😕.

tittle: Would certainly work there again if decided to travel.
author: Registered Nurse
comment: Excellent place to work. Help was readily available when needed. My resource person was easy to get in contact with, and provided valuable insight to a potential problem.

author: RN Staff
comment: They never support their workers, it has been the worse experience in my life. I can't say anything good about this Company . Every time I had a concern, nobody gave me answers

tittle: working for RN Network was a great experience
author: RN Staff Nurse/traveler
comment: I worked with RN network as a traveler to different areas of the country. I never went to the actual office in Florida. Spoke with them on the phone often and had a recruiter that worked closely with me and was always there for me.

cons: ["couldnt always reach benefits persons or recruiter"]
tittle: staff works hard to get you hired

author: Registered Nurse
comment: Solid travel company doing the best they can to offer contracts in a variety of locations with moderate pay for market competition. Recruiters are hospitable and truly care that you are happy.

author: Registered Nurse
comment: nice company to work for. pay was great..staff members were helpful. RN network help me build my skills to become a better nurse. if I had to choose them again, I will.

author: STAFF RN
comment: Helps you get established in your field when you are new to the area. Everyone was very helpful and nice to work with during my transition of employment.

author: Staff Nurse
comment: Traveling was truly and adventure. Management worked with what you were looking for, housing was always great and assignments were fun and adventurous. Areas always had a lot of things to do when not working.

author: Registered Nurse
comment: Working with this travel agency was nice, my recruiter was great and handled everything in a professional manner. The travel agency found work in areas that I requested.

tittle: A personal and professional company with respect for the staff.
author: Registered Nurse
comment: I worked as an Acute Dialysis Nurse and the job is unpredictable as expected, many times extremely log days. It was very difficult achieving a balance with other aspects of life. The people were respectful, available and willing to work out any job related issue. The most enjoyable part of my job was the patient care and ease in working with FMS staff.

author: Registered Nurse
comment: Great people to work for, assignments were easy to set up, no problems with getting paid or renewing contracts. would recommend this travel company for traveling

author: RN
comment: All the employees are helpful & make it about the nurses. I always have the info required for my next location. Supportive all through the contract. enjoyed it.

author: RN
comment: Very productive at job placement. Recruiters treat nurses like family. Staff is easily available and returns calls promptly. Strives to find the best jobs with high pay rates

tittle: Very good place to work as a travel nurse
author: RN
comment: RN network is always on top of things; some one is always available for help; good & very up beat people at RN Network; benifits are good along with the housing

pros: ["benefits, housing, helping with recertification classes, mileage reimbursement, double time for overtime pay"]
author: Registered Nurse
comment: My recruiter is awesome, contacting me every Monday to see how I'm doing. The supervisor is great also. I love this company. The benefit package is great too. My housing has been fantastic. The credentialing department is fantastic, finding classes for recertification.

author: Registered Nurse
comment: A typical day at work was filled with cardiac issues but great teamwork and attitudes to go along with it. I learned how to become competent in a job with little training. comment: I worked for RNNETWORK for approximately 10 years. I found them to be readily accessible and had numerous jobs to choose from. I liked their benefits and really never had an issue with them

author: Registered Nurse
comment: What is the best part of working at the company? My recruiters are amazing and always work to make sure I am happy at the facility I am contracted with.  What is the most stressful part about working at the company? Haven’t had an issue yet thankfully  What is the work environment and culture like at the company? pros: ["Great pay, wonderful team, fast response time"]
author: RN
comment: I have enjoyed working for this company so far. They offer competitive pay, and go out of their way to get you the best pay that you deserve. The recruitment team is great at finding a position that works with my schedule and fits my family.

pros: ["Free lunch, great pay, benefits, stellar team"]
author: Registered Nurse (RN)
comment: My experience with Covelo group has been fantastic. The job I was assigned to could not be better. They even cater us food twice a shift! The work is laid back, the expectations are clear, and my coworkers are pretty easy to get along with overall. Highly recommend.

tittle: Recruiter works hard to support YOU!
author: RN
comment: Refreshing to work for a company who is professional and supportive of their staff! My recruiter promptly returns communications, has been quick to troubleshoot questions during onboarding process and even sent my local Covelo representative to "meet and greet" me on the first day of my contract with a new client. If you are confident in your profession and contract work is something you have never tried and are interested in, I highly recommend Covelo Group, my recruiter and local rep have been amazing!

author: RN Vaccinator
comment: Working with covelo was okay to start, compensation was lower than average but you get what you sign up for. Usually flexible with scheduling depeniding on the location you arr assigned to.

tittle: Friendly staff, smooth onboarding process & good pay
author: RN
comment: I appreciate the opportunity Covelo Group offered me to work for a large reputable hospital in the bay area. The entire boarding process was very smooth, I was given very clear instructions every step along the way. I feel the staff members of Covelo respect their employees and treat them well.

author: Registered Nurse (RN)
comment: As a new grad, working for Covelo has given me the opportunity to work with reputable hospitals within my area. This has helped me build connections with other coworkers and staff members, who I may use as references for future career opportunities. My recruiter was always responsive and helpful to any questions or concerns I had. The other contractors and I initially had some concerns regarding our hours, but Covelo listened and handled the issue promptly with a reasonable solution. All my coworkers have been pleasant to work with and the work culture for my assignment is positive and supportive.

tittle: I liked working for MGA, good company
author: RN/Staff Nurse - Registry
comment: I liked working for MGA, good company, I only separated after, I found full time employment with benefits. Management was professional and fair, no problem with MGA. The work culture was fair and professional.

author: RN Staff Nurse
comment: Very little training. Recruiters were the "go to" people for Nurses, not Nursing Supervisor. No pre-employment testing to assess adequate job skills for the job. And

author: REGISTERED NURSE
comment: Registry work with contracts..You interview with families to determine if you are right fit for their home. You have to work with families schedules in order to get hours. You may have to work with multiple families.

author: Wellness Registered Nurse (RN)
comment: good if you can't find a steady job, they're super nice and youll still get experience, i worked as a flu nurse so it was a good first job out of school,

author: Registered Nurse
comment: Provided travel assignments at distant locations. Frequent cancellations.. Would leave assignments when Staff arrived.Would get paid for four hours when Companies had there employees arrive.

author: Registered Nurse
comment: Okay temp. job but doesn't really provide opportunity for advancement. This agency has more a sales atmosphere feel than one promoting healthcare. Some recruiters don't provide prompt follow-up for job opportunities.

author: Registered Nurse
comment: Provided direct patient and family care. Excelled with nursing skills for long term pediatric care. Coordinated assignments accordingly to meet daily goals and deadlines. Provided family support with home health care. Attended physical therapy treatments to maintain continuity of patient care. Provided flexible hours of operation.

tittle: Office setting with many people at work. nice staff, very calm, no rush
author: RN
comment: The work day did not involve MGA staff very much because we were sent to hospitals and were doing our job there. the staff let us work without hovering over us like other companies might

tittle: Very busy agency with many helpful employees
author: RN
comment: Very accurate and helpful. Very patient. Able to keep me busy most of the time. Handle the background paperwork for the employee which is incredibly helpful.

pros: ["Lots of free tme to play with child"]
tittle: Caring for ill children and encouraging parents
author: RN
comment: Good way to assist parent with difficulties in caring for an ill child. Low stress, high detail to the patient. Very personal in nature every shift.

author: Urgent Care Registered Nurse
comment: typical day at work: Varies with placement  What you learned: first nursing job, learned IM injection, starting IV's, performing blood draws, triage patients in an urgent care facility  Work Culture: varies depending on job placement  The hardest part of job: being flexible about job placement  The most enjoyable part of job: opportunity to explore different areas of nursing and get experience at the same time

cons: ["No benefits, no room for job advancement"]
tittle: Positive experience working with MGA Healthcare
author: RN
comment: MGA Healthcare has been a fantastic experience for me so far! The recruiters that the other nurses and I have worked with/encountered have been extremely polite, responsive, and helpful. They reply to my e-mails and phone calls quickly and are always willing to listen to and address my concerns. My recruiter has also stopped by the facility we are contracted at to check up on us personally and bring us lunch/desserts. He also works closely with the facility's management to ensure that our needs, and their needs from us, are being met adequately.  Only cons are there are no benefits (that I know of) and there isn't much room for job advancement.

author: Registered Nurse
comment: Really great to their nurses and offer great benefits but do not offer a 401k. I love working for them,=. They really look after their nurses. Sometimes even deliver lunches to you and your patient. So easy to pick up shifts

pros: ["Responsive and kind Recruiter and Client Service Manager"]
tittle: Fantastic Recruiter and Client Service Manager who are very responsive.
author: RN
comment: Client Services Manager met me, walked me into the facility and introduced me to the Staff that I would be working with. Questions answered and issues dealt with quickly. Each placement is different, so it is nice when the Sites have been vetted by Covelo Group prior to placing its healthcare professionals. Not a 1099 Contract company, so taxes are taken out of pay, which is a huge plus!

author: Registered Nurse
comment: MGA is a very good staffing agency to work for, I worked the flu shot clinic for 2014 as my very first nursing job. After the temporary position ended, I still received many calls for other positions I was qualified for. Unfortunately I had a full time job and could not further work for MGA. Definitely recommend to new nurses or nurses who may want per diem or temporary shifts.

author: RN
comment: shifts were not always available making it hard to pay the bills at times

tittle: this company was ok to work for
author: Registered Nurse
comment: This company was ok to work for but had limited facilities that is was servicing and limited number of hours that were available.

tittle: Good company with strong values but poor compensation and employee retention
author: Registered Nurse
comment: Below standard pay and no benefits, but the people are nice. There is no help for employees in personal crisis, however, which is unfortunate for a company with such great potential... Management is quick to respond to concerns, but sometimes slow in their resolution of issues. Although the hours are flexible, a nurse might sometimes finds his/herself without any work at all for weeks at a time.

author: Registered Nurse(school based)
state: I haven’t started working yet but l believe it will be a good working environment. The onboarding process has been long. I still don’t have a start date yet.

author: Registered Nurse
comment: There is no orientation. You are thrown in to the wolves They say they are there to support you but they don’t. The pay is no compatible. Director is very unprofessional and speaks to staff like a. Hild

author: Registered Nurse (RN)
comment: You get plenty of time off which is nice, and a lot of nurses like having a schedule that matches their families schedule. They don't pay well and it's almost impossible to get a raise.

tittle: Not A good company to work for
author: RN School Nurse
comment: The pay is Low compared to other companies and no benefits. Health insurance is a whole weeks pay. The responsibilities increase but no pay increases. Not enough staff. Late emails informing you of trainings or Covid protocol changes.

tittle: Great job for a new graduate
author: Registered Nurse
comment: EDU Healthcare is a very organized company, you always have someone available for you contact when needed. Flexible schedule as PRN nurse. I recommend it for a new graduate nurse or someone looking for a part time job.

author: RN
comment: The positive side is a good working schedule similar to Miami Dade Public Schools Calendar. The negative side is low salary with high responsibility level. The working conditions are not the best, at least in the school where I worked.

author: Registered Nurse
comment: The interview and hiring process were simple, quick, and easy. The supervisors communicate and respond on time, and everyone is willing to help their employees be successful.

author: RN
comment: This position is great if you have a love for children. The hours are great if you are a working parent. You get holidays, weekends, and teachers work days off. The con is pay is not great at all!

author: Rn
comment: This job has very flexible hours and you can pick when and where you want to work. Nothing is pressured. Management really makes you feel like your apart of a family. All in all a great place to work

tittle: stressful to have a boss who doesn't know and then demand that you do it wrong
author: RN Staff Nurse
comment: For me, it was the best company in terms of school base. Now they have a new RN director who doesn't know what she is talking about at all. Treat nurses badly, making them feel they don't know anything when she is the one who is lost. It does not matter that she is practically recently graduated but does not lie.

author: Registered Nurse
comment: At this company, you are your own boss. Which is nice. However, there is no support. They should let nurses meet with the families and clients to determine if it would be a good match for all parties. The termination of contract fee is harsh, because sometimes the nurse is in an impossible situation and needs to quit to save and protect his/her license.

author: RN
comment: Contract position for a school in need,nice place to work, excellent office and supporting staff.Far from home to travel for work more than an hour.Working with children in a classroom setting for educational purposes was very rewarding.Hardest part was Clinical chart review of all students for immunizations and medical issues related to beginning and ending school year.

author: Registered Nurse
comment: Just started a summer placement, so limited experience. I can say that my on boarding was quick and very efficiently completed.  I work at a summer school for special needs students, mostly teenagers. The students are the best part of my job. I truly enjoy all of my coworkers-the most dedicated and loving people in all of education.  The hardest part of the job was not having any local person to connect with prior to the first day. I just walked in as a stranger and said, "Hi, I'm the nurse." All the paperwork had been completed through EDUHealthcare. I just felt kind of anonymous at the start. But it is working out very well.

tittle: Diverse group of team members with outgoing personalities
author: Registered Nurse (RN)
comment: A typical day as a EDU Healthcare employee, includes a positive-upbeat work environment. I have enjoyed working with other clinicians employed by EDU Healthcare and students.

author: Registered Nurse
comment: Hiring process was great! Easy to contact recruiters, very helpful. Great schools to work in! Awesome EDU gear, backpack and water bottle! Hours are good.

tittle: Great company for school nursing opportunities
author: Registered Nurse
comment: This company contacted me very quickly after I showed interest online and from the start were extremely helpful. They make the hiring process as painless as possible.

tittle: Rapid response healthcare staffing therefore inconsistent opportunities available. However when opportunities avail themselves this company does is go
author: Emergency Department, Registered Nurse Emergency
comment: I would recommend this company. This company opportunities include rapid responses and short term positions. The company is a responsive employer however can become chaotic during employment for an assignment. This company is constantly tweaking to make the onboarding process more efficient and user-friendly.

author: Staff Nurse
comment: The company is very unorganized. The company lacks communication among each other. Multiple calls from different agents stating contradictory information pertaining to the same subject.

tittle: No job security and you work your butt off.
author: RN Staff Nurse
comment: It was good way back in the day, but no loyalty now. The on-site manager was known to send people home if she didn’t like them and you could never go to them with issues. Shift assignments went to their pets and you were randomly mandated to take a day off if they brought too many people in.

author: Registered Nurse
comment: It used to be owned and operated by a single owner and at the time I traveled they were the best paying travel company . Then the owner passed away and the company incorporated and now they have it divided up into so many different categories of pay vs benefits that now you pretty much just go with the travel company that can put you in the location you want

author: Registered Nurse
comment: The standard one would expect from any healthcare institution. Culture is congruent with the culture of the city it sits in. Work day is standard. 1234

author: Registered Nurse-TRAVEL
comment: Most assignments were to busy units and when assigned unit was not busy, the travel nurse floated first. Host hospitals were easy to work for, never had any conflict, always had any issues resolved quickly and fairly.

pros: ["my recruiter and the salary was above average."]
author: Registered Nurse
comment: I loved all my temporary travel assignments. Labor and Delivery always had many to choices.

cons: ["Sometimes a long distance to isolated locations."]
tittle: Variable schedules, Allowed to refuse certain assignments,
author: Registered Nurse
comment: Nurses and Professionals Healthcare is a local registry started by an RN about 1990. Over the years moved from a two room office in Paradise, CA to a large office complex in Chico. I have worked with this agency since 1994 and have enjoyed my experiences.  A typical day involved organizing the different locations around the state that I was assigned to work. My furthest location was 390 miles from home. I learned to be flexible with assignment requirements and was able to rely on office staff to manage housing, reimbursement of expenses, and to handle any emergencies.  I rarely saw any of my registry coworkers at distance sites but were always cordial.  The hardest part was learning new charting programs at different sites; up to four in a week. Developing proficiency in any one program was difficult.  I most enjoyed the scenic drives through the heart of California and seeing many new areas I have never seen.

author: RN
comment: Again, I find these survey questions annoying. I do not like working as a registry nurse and I do not recommend it to any one. You shouldn't bait and switch people on this site.

cons: ["not much room for advancement in my department"]
author: RN
comment: I enjoy working as a nurse and working with an interdisciplinary team of healthcare professionals. A typical day at my present employment includes working with parents of infants in preparation for discharge and providing parents with the tools and skills necessary to succeed.

pros: ["Great co-workers, great medical director, great workload"]
cons: ["only con was Less money for working for no benefits."]
tittle: Enjoyable atmosphere to work in; good relationships with coworkers, doctors, and clients
author: Staff RN
comment: I worked in Occupational Medicine/Employee Health. We were responsible for giving and reading all employee TB skin tests as well as other immunizations that were needed for work. Our department was also contracted with some local business to do physical assessments and drug screens on their prospective hires. I enjoyed learning the proper way to do a physical assessment. Finding out everything that is involved in doing a drug screen Correctly was very interesting - and finding out the ways people would try to get around it! I always enjoyed my co-workers. Many of us had known each other and worked together in other areas of the hospital for years. I enjoyed everything about the job, including the boss. I think the hardest part of the job was the pay. They were not of the mindset that your pay should be More than average if you are not receiving benefits. As a result, the pay was lower than a new nurse coming in. But I still loved it - fantastic working environment. Miss it.

cons: ["there is no job security and benefits"]
tittle: good place to work for enrtry level
author: Staff Nurse
comment: It is a staffing and caregiving agency. There is no job security. When your patient dies, you lose your job and would wait for days and months before you are given another assignment.

author: RN Travel Nurse
comment: Flexible hours and excellent pay. Opportunity to meet great people. Travel to New areas and learn more about Healthcare. Great Opportunity for overtime, pet friendly housing included.

author: RN Travel Nurse
comment: They “promised” Covid pay in the contract but it was not paid. I was a counselor to my recruiter. When I got Covid I was let go from my contract after working 2 extra days almost weekly.

author: Registered Nurse
comment: No smooth process. Multi submission of documents due to system issues. Difficult to complete if you have to speak to a different person each time. Errors made by associates. Low pay on contracts.

author: RN Staff Nurse
comment: I have enjoyed my time there. Management is good and pays attention to your needs. I feel valued as an employee bug wish work life balance was better.

tittle: Horrible people that doesn't care about their staff
author: RN
comment: Worst place to work. They don't care about you and will stiff you of your pay. Wasted my time to go work for them and I was never paid. Horrible experience for me. Put me off travel nursing.

author: RN
comment: I really love working here, I love my recruiter who works hard to get contracts for me that suit my needs. I wish there were more available contracts.

author: RN
comment: I have completed 6 travel assignments with them. My recruiter has been awesome, all other supportive staff has been amazing. No payroll issues, checks have been on time and correct for each assignment.

author: RN
comment: This is the worst agency I’ve ever had a contract with — poor communication and zero support. My contract ended in 2020 and I am STILL upset about the whole experience. AVOID!

author: Registered Nurse
comment: Overall good experience on multiple assignments. My recruiter was very responsive and had a good working relationship. Had one bad experience on one assignment and wasn’t well supported by company.

pros: ["Paychecks on time, no issues, very straightforward."]
tittle: My recruiter was respectful and answered all questions. Worked with them for a year. Paychecks are always on time, had no issues at any of my jobs
author: RN
comment: My recruiter was respectful and answered all questions. Worked with them for a year. Paychecks are always on time, had no issues at any of my jobs. Very responsive you can always reach someone.

cons: ["Lack of recruiter support when issues came up."]
tittle: I can't think if anything that stands out. Benefits are not as plentiful as other companies
author: RN Travel Nurse
comment: Did not feel my recruiter stood up for me when needed and allowed me to be transferred from the original contract area to another area without asking if I wanted to go to the new area. An issue came up while working with this company and I didnt feel as though I had any back up.

tittle: You have to stay on top of recruiter...
author: Registered Nurse
state: Found that had to frequently direct and then redirect recruiter in obtaining placements and answers.  Be careful. They ask you to pay for things up front and say they will will reimburse you sometimes over $300 up front prior to working things and when say no they continue to ask you to pay saying will be reimbursed. Say they cover expenses to get ready for the job Such as drug testing and vaccinations. Was told needed a current vaccination that had they told me 2 days earlier could have gotten at doctor office when there but as such would have had to make another appointment so while getting drug tested and fit tested was given vaccine and theythen come back and say that not covering that so they end up taking it out of paycheck.  Management is so so.  Poor turn around on answering questions answered.

author: Registered Nurse
comment: Staff will work with you to get the assignment and compensation you desire. Very organized and responsive. Staff is friendly and always willing to answer questions.

cons: ["No loyalty, take money away if you miss a day of work, too much overhead staff"]
tittle: They don’t have your back but always side with the company you’re currently working at if something goes wrong
author: Registered Nurse
comment: They don’t have their employees backs whenever the company you’re working at tells blatant lies, you get physically attacked by a pt and they drop you like a hot potato! They take money away from your pay if you miss a day of work even though we already don’t get paid since we have no sick day pay. They have way too many hands in the cookie jar that with every assignment your core team always changes!!

tittle: Have completed a few travel assignement and did not have a problem.
author: RN
comment: Work-life balance Work-life balance at RNnetwork is travel nursing contract negotiations  Management In general, managers at RNnetwork easy to communicate with

author: RN
comment: My recruiter looked out for me and my interests. She would call and check on me to make sure everything was doing ok. The only complaint I had was that the hospital canceled my contract with no warning and RN network did not offer any compensation for my immediate loss of work

cons: ["Changes in ancillary staff not being communicated in timely manner."]
tittle: Traveler support services are changing. I have a great relationship with my recruiter and am very happy.
author: RN Travel Nurse
comment: Travel nurses need support services that they can count on, I have been pleased with the results. My recruiter has been great fun and great at her job.

tittle: If you dont mind working alone, and like to travel - this job is for you.
author: RN
comment: Typical day at work depends on what area of facility/hospital you work in. You will learn how travel nurses are received at a facility. Management changes hands with your shift schedules. Workplace culture is great.

author: Registered Nurse
comment: RNnetwork is a travel nurse agency with great benefits and insurance. Part of my review is skewed because it’s having to evaluate where I’ve worked which RNNetwork has no control, as they found me an assignment and place to work so things like making me feel inclusive, or management isn’t totally about RNnetwork but where I was assigned. RNnetwork is a great company and I thoroughly enjoyed working with them. They were always there for me when I needed them.

author: Traveling Registered Nurse
comment: Good people to work for. Recruiters are good and try to get you decent pay packages. Travel nursing as a whole is going downhill, but some companies try to make the most of it still.

author: RN
comment: I think my recruiter could have been more support at the time. I understand they need to get people into the job but during this time they should have been more support to the employee

author: RN Travel Nurse
comment: Flexible hours and excellent pay. Opportunity to meet great people. Travel to New areas and learn more about Healthcare. Great Opportunity for overtime, pet friendly housing included.

cons: ["I worked for a facility with poor conditions"]
author: REGISTERED PROFESSIONAL NURSE
comment: The company doesn’t do the work for you. You have to do all the connecting by yourself ( I. E. the license, the room and board, the drug and health screening and the actual job), as the company is not local; they just pay you. In some cases, you have to find your own work. If you happen to allow them to hook up room and transportation, make sure you have ( or they provide you with) a reliable way of getting to work; it could 30 miles away from where you live! ....🙄😕.

tittle: Would certainly work there again if decided to travel.
author: Registered Nurse
comment: Excellent place to work. Help was readily available when needed. My resource person was easy to get in contact with, and provided valuable insight to a potential problem.

author: RN Staff
comment: They never support their workers, it has been the worse experience in my life. I can't say anything good about this Company . Every time I had a concern, nobody gave me answers

tittle: working for RN Network was a great experience
author: RN Staff Nurse/traveler
comment: I worked with RN network as a traveler to different areas of the country. I never went to the actual office in Florida. Spoke with them on the phone often and had a recruiter that worked closely with me and was always there for me.

cons: ["couldnt always reach benefits persons or recruiter"]
tittle: staff works hard to get you hired
author: RN
comment: staff works hard to get you hired. working at different facilities on a frequent basis gives you the opportunity to learn about new medical issues - equipment, care of specialty patients, other ancillary staff, new MD interns. Must be able to navigate in any new city they send you to and find your own accomidations if necessary. Must provide some of your own equipment to perform daily duties - O2 sat probe, stethoscope, pill cutter, pill crusher, vein finder if affordable.

author: Registered Nurse
comment: Solid travel company doing the best they can to offer contracts in a variety of locations with moderate pay for market competition. Recruiters are hospitable and truly care that you are happy.

author: Registered Nurse
